Making a visit to a house.
15.content: All right, let's list some other places.
15.title: Somewhere else

choices: She pulls out a "manga" of her own
She gives him a website link
151.content:
It was yet another day for Lucy Wong, traveling from place to place promoting her program. Now that she disliked it in any way though. She did it as she was passionate about it.

On this day in particular, she had made a stop for some gas on her way to her next session. Just one of many trips she had made on her trip. She didn't mind them though, as these stops often allowed her to see more people, and you never knew just what types of people you might be able to meet and help to change along the way.

Really she couldn't count how many people she had helped from little stops along the way, and perhaps this would be no different.

Inside the store, she was searching along for a few things for the remainder of her trip. Simple ordinary stuff that anyone else would do of course. It wasn't long before she was about to check out what she had bought, particularly because the store wasn't getting much business at the moment, leaving her alone with the few employees.

Lucy walked up to the counter, her eyes going to the clerk at the register who was slightly turned to her. Appeared to be a young man, probably in his 20's somewhere, with brown hair and brown eyes. Probably someone who was in college or just out of it if she had to guess. He appeared to be staring attentively at something, perhaps reading if she had to guess. That seemed curious. She smiled as she walked up to the counter, the sound of her steps alerting the boy.

"Oh!" he suddenly turned to see her coming up. "Sorry about that? You found everything alright?"

"I did thanks," Lucy smiled, looking at the guy's nametag. "Sam is it?"

"Yeah, Sam Farmer," the boy said, before getting a better look at the woman as he was checking the items. "And uh....are you Lucy Wong? I happened to see you on TV once."

"Indeed I am," Lucy smiled. "It catch your interest?"

"It was...interesting," Sam said a little unsure. "Though, if I may be honest, it does feel really hard to get such a life. I feel like there are a lot of people who try hard but end up with little."

"Trust me, you wouldn't be the first to say that," Lucy nodded. "Getting on the right track in life can be hard. You just have to find it somewhere."

As she said that, she happened to glance down. Apparently whatever Sam had been reading wasn't fully hidden, and she could make out what looked like a Japanese manga.

"Ah, is that your passion down there?" she asked, making Sam jump a little.

Seeing that he had failed to fully hide it, he blushed a little.

"Y-Yeah, I kind of like that stuff," he said. "Always have. Just always looked interesting to me. Big fan."

"That's good to know," Lucy smiled, paying for everything with her credit card. "I'm curious, is that the sort of life you'd want?"

That kind of sounded like a loaded question, not the one Sam had ever had anyone ask him before. Honestly, he tried to keep many of his manga/anime interests a secret from most other people as it felt a little embarrassing to talk about. Still, she had caught him red-handed, and on the one day he thought he wouldn't have a problem.

"I guess I would," he said. "Sounds more interesting than the one I have right now."

"I see," Lucy nodded, her smile still there. "In that case, I might just have something for you."

Lucy kept a whole bunch of things in her bag, one for many types of situations. Plus, guys with interests such as these were more common than you'd think. She had come across many who liked the idea of an anime world.
151.title: She's making a stop for gas.

choices: Sam wakes up as Minato at the very beginning
Sam wakes up as Nina after the first chapter
1511.content:
Lucy reached into her bad and pulled out a small paperback book and handed it Sam.

“Here take this. It’s a special Manga. Not even on the market yet. Read it and I’m sure it will change your life.” She said with a smile and small wink.

Normally Sam would feel awkward taking something from a stranger but considering the celebrity Lucy Wong was he didn’t feel weird about it. He took the book thanking her as paid for her gas and left.

Sam finished his shift a short time later as he went back to his apartment and decided to read the Manga before bed. It was rather short. Only an introduction to the main story so Sam figured it was worth a quick read. Sam sat down and over the next hour finished the book as he actually quite liked the story.

The story was “Guardians.” It was about a young guy named Minato who was your typical Anime High schooler around 18. He was rather shy and kept to himself and lived alone.

He lived in a fictional version of modern Tokyo that seemed normal except the city had a serious problem. Occasionally the city would come under attack from black shadow monsters known as Daemons. These monsters came in all shapes and sizes but all of them had shadowy black ink like bodies except for their glowing yellow eyes, and were bent on destroying everything they could.

Nobody knows where Daemons come from as they disappear and vanish as quickly as they appear. It also seems like traditional weapons are useless again them. Bullets and modern weapons don’t affect them at all. Humanity had no answer to these monsters who never even spoke of what they wanted or where they came from. All they cared about was destruction.

That was until the Guardians appeared. Strange women all young and beautiful. They seemed to wield some sort of magic based off the elements which was also conveniently color coordinated to their hair color in typical anime style. These Guardians used their magic and enhanced physical abilities to fight off the Daemons.

However just like the Daemons nobody seemed to know anything about the Gaurdians except that they always fought together in pairs and that they were always young and beautiful females. Some people regard them as heroes while others believe they are connected to the Daemons themselves and don’t trust them.

The story begins with Minato who on his way home one day is seeing the aftermath of a terrible Daemon battle where the Gaurdian involved is presumed dead. Minato sees something on the ground and realizes it’s a golden ring with an deep blue jewel in the center that matches his very blue anime eyes and hair. He picks up the ring and just out of curiosity tries it on only to realize it won’t come off.

The next day Minato is awoken early to a knocking at his door and sees a strange girl he has never seen before standing there. She is about his age and kinda cute. She had short faded red hair and a really skinny body with small breasts and not much of a figure.

The next scene is a rather humorous one as the girl seeks really confused to see Minato there as she lets herself in his place confused as if she is looking for someone else. The whole time Minato is only wearing a towel and really embarrassed as he tried to push her out of her apartment.

When he finally gets her to explain herself the girl explains that her named is Rosuko but most people just call her Rose. She says she was told her new partner was here but is confused because all she sees is a boy.

Minato has no idea what she is talking about and tries to push her away only for Rose to see his ring as she holds up one she is wearing that’s looks the same only with a fiery red jewel instead.

Rose explains she is a guardian and that she is very new to the profession. Her mentor and former partner was killed in a Daemon attack last night which means her ring was sent off to find a new host and for some reason it chose him, which is normally very odd because all guardians are supposed to be female.

Minato doesn’t really believe her at first as he tries to go to school but Rose seems determined to stick by his side in a cute and adorable yet also funny and kinda annoying way.

On their way to school they are attacked however by a Daemon and Rose reveals she is telling the truth as she activates her ring and undergoes a very anime style transformation.

Her body changes from a skinny timid girl to a sexy and voluptuous fire red bombshell. Her hair becomes fiery red and grows much longer as does her eyes and nails. She develops great curves and her breasts grow larger. Her outfit also changes to a skin tight fiery red one piece leotard with matching skin tight boots. She looks like a sexy superhero when she is done.

The new Rose also has a very different personality. While before she was awkward and clumsy. Now she is hot tempered and overly confident. She also shows off her fiery powers that correspond with her new personality.

The new Rose tries to hold off the Daemon who seems bent in going after Minato but by herself it’s too strong and right before the Daemon is about to crush Minato ulhis ring glows as he too undergoes a similar transformation.

His body becomes female with very large breasts and great curves as his deep blue hair grows longer than his waist. He becomes a total anime girl knock out as his outfit changes to tight blue sports bra and skin tight blue booty shorts. There was definitely a lot of fan service with this design.

After his transformation the new female Minato tries to defend herself as beams of ice shoot out of her hands. She has no idea how to control this power but it gives Rose the upper hand enough to team up and force the Daemon to flee.

The new female Minato is obviously freaked out by his new body as Rose tries to calm him down explaining once his changes he won’t be able to change back until he falls asleep and wakes up the next morning.

To prevent any confusion Rose refers to Minato as just Nina now as she tries to explain the situation a bit. Nina actually passes out from the shock of everything and that ends the first chapter setting up a whole new possible series of adventures for them.

Sam thought the book was actually pretty good but didn’t think it was life changing as he yawned and went to bed not realizing how wrong he just was...

What happens in the morning?
1511.title: She pulls out a "manga" of her own

15111.content:
With nothing else to do, Sam got into bed for the night. Honestly, as much as he might have wanted to give the manga a second look to see if he missed anything, he had more work to do in the morning. Yeah, pretty much that most days of the week. In all honesty, it did make him wonder about such an anime-style life. Would the constant craziness be an upgrade compared to this world? Or is it just thinking the grass is greener on the other side?

Bah, he was too tired for this kind of thinking, and it was beginning to get really late. Putting the manga away, he got into bed and turned the light off. You know, it still lingered in his head how Lucy Wong would have such a thing on hand. Maybe she was a big fan? Oh, but she said it wasn't even on market. Or maybe she was just messing with him.

Well, as he finally was able to get to sleep, he failed to notice a slight glow coming from the desk where he left the manga. As the hours passed, it slowly got brighter and brighter, though not enough to wake him up, merely just making him stir a bit. However, that all changed once the clock in his room struck midnight.

Because right at that moment, the manga flashed open, engulfing the whole room in light.

The Next Day

The digital clock alarm sounded at about 7:00, causing the rooms inhabitant to groan as he turned it off.

"Ugh....not nearly enough time..." groaned the boy as he slowly got up, yawning and stretching the whole way.

Looked like just another morning for Minato Takahashi. 18 years old, living on his own, and living out the final year of high school. Probably not the best arrangement but it could be worse. The solitary life style suited him more or less, and it wasn't like he had no acquaintances at all. He knew some people at school, despite being shy and mostly keeping to himself.

That beside the point though, he couldn't remember what he was dreaming about last night, only that it was really, really weird. Like a completely out of body experience or something. It was bizarre to say the least. Well, guess there was no time in worrying about it. He had to get going.

Typical to his routine, he took a shower before getting his uniform on, taking a brief look at his blue hair to make sure he at least didn't have a lot of bedhead. Last thing he needed was for attention to be drawn to him. After that, he began fixing some breakfast, all the while hearing the news on the TV.

Looks like it was talking more about those Daemons, such as another attack during the later hours of yesterday. Suffice to say it was concerning when those things showed up, made going from place to place more dangerous for sure. Tokyo hadn't been the same for many years since they came. And those "Guardians" or whatever, they were just as much an enigma. He wasn't sure what to make of them, but he supposed it didn't matter too much. As long as they helped, it wasn't an issue.

In any case, he gathered all his things once he was good to go, taking a deep breath as he began to leave his apartment, going out into the bright Tokyo sun. The view from the 3rd floor gave a pretty picturesque view of Tokyo, a shot straight out of an anime with its bright colors. Not that that sort of thing made any difference to him. To him, this was just life in general.

And with that, he began to make his way down, start of another day. Suzumiya High was a decent walk after all.
15111.title: Sam wakes up as Minato at the very beginning

choices: Rosuko lets herself into Minato’s place
Minato tries to get rid of her
151111.content:
Minato was dressed in his black school uniform very typical for boys at his school. He saw girls passing him wearing their white blouses and black skirts. It was nearing quarterly exams so people were rushing to school to finish up final projects before break.

Minato was a decent student. Not the top at all but no where near the bottom. He had no idea what he was going to do next year. He still had to figure it out on his own.

As he hurried to school he suddenly heard an all to familiar alarm sound as police whistles and sirens began to bellow. Minato and every Japanese person knew what this meant all too well....It signaled a Daemon attack.

Down the street a few block a strange black portal began to emerge from out of no where. Dark sparks of lightning and energy cracked and shot off the portal as a dark shadowy figure began to emerge from it...

Like all Daemons this monster was pure black like it was made of shadows and darkness. Except for its eyes...Those were always glowing a bright yellow. Most Daemons also took on shapes that were at least familiar to things in the world. Sometimes they looked like birds, lizards, insects, sometimes even they took on human like shapes although those were most rare and most dangerous.

The Daemon emerging from this portal seemed to look like a spider of sorts. Eight huge legs and nasty pincers and teeth with eight glowing yellow eyes. The spider was least the size of a city bus and it wasted no time in beginning to cause terror downtown...

Minato had never been this close to Daemon encounter before. There were relatively uncommon so it wasn’t expected to actually see one only a couple blocks away.

People were fleeing the deamon as they screamed in terror as the monster used it giant legs to smash cars and destroy whatever was in its way. The police and military were showing up and doing what they could but all bullets and traditional weapons could ever hope to do was slow it down. In reality all they really did was make it more angry...

There was suddenly a bright flash of light as a bright blue and a bright red light seemed to appear out of nowhere. Minato couldn’t see exactly what it was but it seemed like the lights were coming from two women.

Minato could barely make out the action from so far away but he did see flashes of light and as it looked like the women were using superhuman speed and strength to jump around and fight the spider as they shot what looked like beams of fire and ice from their hands to hurt it.

The police finally got to his street as he directed everyone to flee. Since the daemon attack was so close they were postpone school for the day. It was one of the only positives of a daemon attack.

Minato turned around and began to rush back to his apartment the sounds of fighting and explosions getting louder and louder much to close for comfort.

A few block down the road Minato was finally out of the danger zone. The fighting seemed to have stopped as emergency services were arriving to treat the wounded. There was no sign of the daemon or the guardians who arrived to stop it.

“That was close...thank goodness those guardians showed up.” Minato thought to himself.

Not much was known of the guardians. They seemed to be the only ones capable of fighting the Daemons. They were super powered people who were apparently all young women. Their origins were just as mysterious as the Daemons but it seemed like right now there were the only hope humanity had.

Minato saw his apartment ahead of him as he rushed to get home. He was covered in dust and debris from the battle now so he wanted to get home and shower. As he was about to take the steps up to his place Minato saw a small glimmer in the corner of his eye. It looked sort of like a shiny blue light coming from the bushes near the stairs of his apartment.

Minato paused for a moment as he saw the glimmer again more clearly coming from the bushes as he decided to see what it was. Reaching closer Minato pulled out a small metal ring from the bushes as he examined it. The ring was beautiful. Golden with interesting designs engraved into the band. There was a also a very bright and shiny blue jewel in the center.

“Wow...this is nice. I wonder how much it’s worth?” He asked himself. Nobody in his neighborhood ever wore a ring this fancy looking so he was curious where it came from.

Out of curiosity Minato slipped the ring into his middle finger on his right hand and found that surprisingly it fit perfectly. It was almost like it was designed for him.

“Oh nice, it’s a little feminine for my style though.” He said to himself trying to take it off.

The ring however refused to budge...Minato tugged and pulled...nothing. He went inside and tried water, butter, oil, nothing worked. It was like the ring was now attached to him permanently.

“I’ll deal with this later....” He said in frustration as he still wanted to take a shower to get all the dust and debris off of him.

Minato took a nice hot shower as he jumped out feeling refreshed wrapping a towel around his waist. He was about to get dressed when all of a sudden there was a knock on his door.

“Maybe that’s package I ordered online.” Minato thought to himself as he went to answer the door Opening it as he suddenly froze as his eyes went wide...

Standing in front of him wasn’t a delivery person but a girl...

She appeared about his age and was wearing a white blouse and black skirt showing she was a student at his school. She was wearing black leggings and dress shoes and she had large rounded glasses on. Her hair was a faded auburn color. Not quite red and not quite orange or yellow either. More like a red that had its color taken away. Her eyes were also a light auburn color to match.

She was very skinny and rather short only 5’2 at most. Her figure wasn’t much to speak of with smaller breasts and not much curves. She looked very shy by nature and had a cute kind of bookworm look to her as far a anime girls go. The only thing that really stood out was she was also wearing a very fancy looking golden ring but this one had a red gem in the center.

“Hi...Umm...I’m Rosuko...I’m here to find my new partner. If she around here somewhere?” Rosuko asked Minato who was trying to cover himself with his towel having no idea what this girl was talking about...
151111.title: Heading to School

1511111.content:
"Uh....W-What?" Minato asked with a stupefied look. No doubt he looked really out of sorts given his current attire, or lack there of. Great, the one time a girl actually approaches him, it's when he's got nothing but a cloth on.

For a second, it was hard to tell if Rosuko had any idea as to Minato's apparent situation. Her face was already blushing, though it didn't seem related to his attire. Though, after a little bit of an awkward silence, one of Rosuko's eyes finally opened back up, looking up Minato a bit. And that was when her face definitely got red, steam beginning to come out of her ears.

"A-AH! I'm so sorry!" she panicked a bit, jumping in the air a bit. "I-I didn't realize you were occupied!"

"I-It's okay! I'm sorry!" Minato cried right back, neither of the two obviously in a good situation. "Uh, I-I'm not sure who you're looking for though...."

"It's....It's a girl who should have a ring like this.....only blue," Rosuko got a little bit of her blush under control, showing off the ring she had on her own right hand. Actually, more like pointing so close to his face that it nearly hit him.

Getting a closer look, Minato's face paled a bit. Up close, it really looked like his own. In fact, the design was pretty much identical, the only difference being the ruby red gem instead of his more sapphire-like one. How...how could two rings like that be so identical? Not to mention, what made these rings so weird, like not even bothering to come off his hand? What in the world was going on today?!

"Uh....you mean....this?" Minato said in an unsure voice, slowly bringing up his own right hand.

Rosuko's eyes blinked a bit, actually blinked multiple times as her eyes traveled to his hand. There were a few more seconds of awkward silence....until........

"AHHHHHHHHHH!" she cried out, probably making the whole complex rumble. "It's you?!"

She immediately started inspecting the ring a bit, pulling Minato around a ways all while she did that. It was a miracle that his towel was actually able to stay on the whole time, preventing even more embarrassment. Still, whatever this girl was on about, she was really flustered at this, constantly blabbering to herself as she looked the ring over.

"I can't believe this!" she cried out, eventually letting go and allowing Minato to fall to the ground.

"Owww....." he groaned, slowly getting up. "What's this all about?"

"Uh...well....it's best that we talk inside," Rosuko sighed, uttering a little apology before turning and making herself inside.

"Sure....make yourself at home," Minato groaned a bit as he followed behind her, closing the door as he did.

Rosuko paced about the decent apartment a little bit, still mumbling to herself as she went back and forth. It was clear she had something to say, but didn't know how exactly to say it. Honestly, now that you got a closer look at her, she looked more than a little dirty, kind of like how you were when coming back from the Daemon battle. Did she come from there too?

"Um...just give me a minute..." Minato said.

"Sure," Rosuko said, grabbing a nearby cloth to wash her face a bit.

Minato left to at least dress himself in something casual. Anything to avoid any more embarrassment given how this day was going so far. He made sure he was presentable enough before returning to where Rosuko stayed, still looking as antsy as before.

"So, what's this all about?" Minato asked finally.
1511111.title: Rosuko lets herself into Minato’s place

choices: Rose decides to go with her plan
15111111.content:
Rosuko begins to explain everything as best as she can. It’s obvious she feels super awkward.

“Well...Umm...I’m a guardian...and I guess you are now one too.” She said adjusting her glasses.

“Wait...this ring is what makes you a guardian? How am I supposed to believe you?” Minato asked obviously skeptical.

“Well....it’s just...my partner...she was mentor. She didn’t survive that last daemon attack. She has been training me for about a month now. I still can barely control it myself at this point. When a guardian dies their ring chooses a near host but I’ve never seen it chose a boy before....All guardians are women.” Rosuko explained.

Minato did realize that all Guardians were women and had been since they appeared.

“So why did it chose me? Am I supposed to be the first male guardian or something?” Minato asked only entertaining this idea he hadn’t actually accepted it yet.

“I’m....not sure. I dunno either but for some reason the Ice ring chose you. Right now there are six rings out there and each guardian works with a partner meaning there are three teams that each protect different areas from Daemons. This is the fire ring and we are team 1 also called fire and ice. Team two is earth and air, and team 3 is light and darkness. Each time watches over certain parts of city. This part of the city is ours to protect. Each of our rings give us guardians the strength and power we need to fight back the daemons.” Rosuko explained.

Her story made sense but still Minato had no reason to believe her. Honestly how could this shy girl be some secret awesome superhero?

“Listen...even if...I believed you what do you want me to do?” Minato asked.

“Well...Umm...I guess I am supposed to be your mentor now. I can teach you how to transform and use your powers to help protect the city from Daemons...” Rosuko said shyly.

“Transform? Like I get to become all super strong and get a sweet outfit?” Minato said as he was picturing himself looking like a sweet superhero from all those movies he watched as a kid.

“Well...Uhh...sorta...I dunno how the transformation will affect you it affects everyone differently. When we change our bodies and personality changes.” Rosuko explained.

Minato still didn’t really buy this yet. However he couldn’t deny his curiosity....

“Well...if you are telling the truth why don’t you prove it? Transform now into your super guardian form.” Minato said.

“Please....I...I don’t like changing. I get really hot tempered and brash...It’s hard to control my emotions when I’m like that.” Rosuko said.

“Really? You can’t change just to prove it? How am I supposed to be your partner if you won’t trust me?” Minato said.

“Fine...please....don’t....think bad of me.” Rosuko said standing up and taking a deep breath as she held up her hand as the red gem on the ring began to glow.

It was at this exact moment Minato realized that she may have been telling the truth.

In true Anime style Rosuko suddenly underwent a marvelous transformation. Her hair suddenly turned fiery red as he grew longer and longer all the way down to her ankles as he flowed around her body. Her eyes also too became fiery red as did her finger nails which grew longer. Her body also changed getting taller and more shapely as grew more toned muscles on her legs and arms as her hips widened and even her butt grew more shapely. Her breasts expanded greatly becoming at least DDs. Overall her body looked like a fiery hot bombshell. Lastly her clothes also changed turning into a fiery red mini skirt and crop top along with matching red heels.

Standing there Minato was stunned and at a loss for words as he stared at the firey bombshell girl in his apartment...

“Hot damn that feels good! See I told you! Dummy I wasn’t joking okay! Oh jeez I forget my clothes always change and since I’m not fighting I don’t have my battle suit I’m stuck wearing this sexy and slutty clothes now are you happy? Wait...don’t answer that you perv!” Rosuko said as her personality was definitely different now.

“Umm...I...Uhh...how?” Minato said at a total loss for words.

“I told you I was a guardian dumbass! All guardians change like this. I’m still new though so don’t judge me okay! I’m not an expert on all this stuff yet!” Rosuko said in a huff.

“Im sorry I doubted you Rosuko...I just didn’t know...” Minato began to say.

“Call me Rose when I’m like this. I’m still me but I like that name in this form it helps me stand out more.”Rose said examining herself in a nearby mirror.

“Damn I really am hot aren’t I? Also don’t get any ideas I’m just your partner okay?” Rose said shooting him a dirty look.

Minato held up his hand like a scout doing an honor pledge. He was a intimidated now seeing her true form.

“So...what should we do next?” Minato asked.

“Well we need to get you to change...normally a daemon encounter does the trick but sense that might be awhile we need to come up with another idea....Let’s see we need to replicate the stress of a daemon attack...” Rose began to ponder as she suddenly got a wicked idea.

“I could toss you in the air....I may not look it but I’m really strong in this form I could probably toss you a few hundred feet in the air. You should be able to use that stress to change and land back safely...” Rose said standing up.

“Wait....you can be serious why don’t you just tell me the trick and I will figure it out?” Minato said backing up until he ran out of room...
15111111.title: Rosuko begins to explain

151111111.content:
"Nope, you're coming with me!" Rose suddenly reached out, grabbing Minato with inhuman speed. "Trial by fire as they say."

It took Minato a few second to remember that Rose was a far bit aways from him when he was trying to run out. How in the world did she grab him that fast?! Guess he really couldn't deny all this stuff about being a Guardian. Granted, it was more freaking him out than anything right now. Still, guess she had no choice but to accept it for now, despite the fact that this would mean even more time spent as Nina than Minato. Hopefully she could balance all of this somehow.

Well, in any case, it was probably time to get some schoolwork done before dinner. As Minato, Nina was decently good at that so getting started wasn't hard. Rose found it a little difficult to get going though.

After getting ready for school they headed off to catch the train when all of a sudden both of their rings started to blink.

“Uh oh...daemon alert we have to go!” Rosuko said taking Minato by the hand.

After they changed Rose looked at her ring as she tapped it as a map of the city suddenly appeared like a hologram in front of them.

“It’s a special feature of the rings, only works during a daemon attack. Tells us the location of the portal and the class of daemon expected to emerge.” Rose said.

Nina was a bit confused.

“Class of Daemon?” She asked.

“Yes...Daemons come in several classes. Class-C is the weakest. Usually about the size of small or medium sized car. They are more of a nuisance than a threat. However they still have to be stopped. Usually a single guardian is more than enough to stop one. Class- B is the most common. They are usually about the size of a city bus and can cause major damage if not stopped quickly. They usually require a pair of guardians to stop and is the reason we always work in teams. Class- A types are the serious major threats. They are usually the size of a small building and can threaten the entire city if left alone. If one of them appears we have to call for back up from the other guardian teams. We also must respond to any of their alarms if one appears in their district. It usually takes four or more guardians to stop a Class A. They are never to be engaged alone!” Rose said in a stern tone.

“Is that all the types?” Nina asked.

“Well...technically there are rumors of a Type-S. No one can be sure though as there is no official recorded events of one actually appearing. If that ever happens we would have to send out a massive alarm and get every guardian possible to try to stop it. Probably evacuate the city and everything.” Rose said with a bit of fear in her voice.

As she looked on her hologram map she saw an image of a portal emerging a few blocks away in the middle of the street.

“Thank goodness looks like this is just a class-C. A perfect introduction into your first battle!” Rose said with a smile.

“Are you sure? I haven’t had any training yet?” Nina asked.

“Of course...use your instincts...trust your feelings and you will be fine. I will stand by as your back up.” Rose said giving Nina a pat on the back as they rushed off to face the daemon.

Nina followed Rose who took her to the scene as they saw the Daemon emerge from the portal. Similar to others before it a black ink like figure emerged from the portal as it looked like a giant...frog?

Nothing....

info.brief_description: Why be an underachieving guy when you can be a GAL?
info.description:
Meet Lucy Wong. Lucy is a motivational speaker who tours the country promoting her surefire success plan: The Gain-A-Life program. Gain-A-Life is the surefire success strategy that has helped thousands, from business magnates, to titans of industry, to professional athletes, to ordinary people. Lucy can help anybody become the best person they can possibly be.

For most people, Gain-A-Life is nothing more than motivational speech, encouragement, seizing opportunity, interpersonal relationships, and an examination of healthy life choices.

But for a select few, Lucy offers a bit more help.

Some people either can't or won't get any better. Sometimes they were dealt a bad hand. Sometimes they made bad choices. Sometimes they're just jerks. Luckily, Lucy knows exactly what these poor men need. Even if they don't want it.

Yes, Lucy and her patented Gain-A-Life system can help you be the best person you can be. But sometimes, you can be far greater as someone entirely else... and female, too.


RULES:

+ No nonhuman transformations
+ No graphic depictions of sex or violence
+ No death
+ Use good grammar and spelling. If English is not your first language, or if you write like a ten year-old, your chapter may be edited.
+ Lucy is not evil. Everyone transformed must end better off than when they started
